newsitem.title: JAPAN: HIS plans to start Japan domestic flights-reports.
newsitem.headline: HIS plans to start Japan domestic flights-reports.

text.p: H.I.S. Co Ltd, a Tokyo-based discount airline ticket agency, plans to start regular domestic flights in two years in a bid to compete with the three major airline companies dominating the Japanese market, Japanese media reported over the weekend.
It would be the first time in 43 years that a new company would be set up to offer nationwide flights.

The company plans to set up a new company in Tokyo next month aiming to inaugurate Haneda-Sapporo flights at half the current fare. The new company will be capitalised at 100-200 million yen and H.I.S. will take a 30-70 percent stake in the new company, according to the media reports.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment.

The media reports said the company aims to apply for a government license to operate the domestic flights early next year. After that, it plans to become an airline operator with additional capital of several billion yen.

The company plans to rent three aircraft from leasing companies with a capacity of about 300 people and to hire foreign pilots and crew at lower salaries than those paid to Japanese crews, the reports said.
It would consign servicing of the planes to the major domestic airlines, they said.

The company intends to obtain some of Haneda airport's allotment of 40 new flights early next year after completion of a new runaway there and to start six round-trips a day, the reports said. -- Tokyo Equities Desk +81-3-3432-9052
